text.0: for first possession of your juice for the exhilarating drink.
text.1: drive ye away the dog my friends drive ye the longtongued dog away.
text.2: he who with purifying stream effused comes flowing hitherward.
text.3: indu is like an able steed.
text.4: the men with allpervading song send unassailable soma forth.
text.6: the somas very rich in sweets for which the sieve is destined flow.
text.7: effused the source of indras joy may your strong juices reach the gods.
text.8: indu flows on for indras sake thus have the deities declared.
text.9: the lord of speech exerts himself ruler of all because of might.
text.10: inciter of the voice of song with thousand streams the ocean flows.
text.11: even soma lord of opulence the friend of indra day by day.
text.12: as pūṣan fortune bhaga comes this soma while they make him pure.
text.13: he lord of the multitude hath looked upon the earth and heaven.
text.14: the dear cows lowed in joyful mood together to the gladdening drink.
text.15: the drops as they were purified the soma juices made then paths.
text.16: o pavamana bring the juice the mightiest worthy to be famed.
text.17: which the five tribes have over them whereby we may win opulence.
text.18: for us the soma juices flow the drops best furtherers of our weal.
text.19: effused as friends without a spot benevolent finders of the light.
text.20: effused by means of pressingstones upon the oxhide visible.
text.21: they treasurefinders have announced food unto us from every side.
text.22: tlese soma juices skilled in song purified blent with milk and curd.
text.23: when moving and when firmly laid in oil resemble lovely suns.
text.24: let not the power of men restrain the voice of the outpouring juice.
text.25: as bhṛgus sons chased makha so drive ye the greedy hound away.
text.26: the friend hath wrapped him in his robe as in his parents arms a son.
text.27: he went as lover to a dame to take his station suitorlike.
text.28: that hero who produces strength he who hath propped both worlds apart.
text.29: goldhued hath wrapped him in the sieve to settle priestlike in his place.
text.30: soma upon the oxs skin through the sheeps wool flows purified.
text.31: bellowing out the tawny steer goes on to indras special place.
